thread.title: Report: Nationals nearing deal with catcher Matt Wieters
thread.title_full: Report: Nationals nearing deal with catcher Matt Wieters

title: Report: Nationals nearing deal with catcher Matt Wieters
text:
Report: Nationals nearing deal with catcher Matt Wieters The Washington Nationals are reportedly close on a deal with free-agent catcher Matt Wieters. Slot to 247Sports Links 
The Washington Nationals may have found their starting catcher for the 2017 season. 
The team is reportedly nearing a contract agreement with free-agent catcher Matt Wieters, per MLB.com . Terms of a potential deal are not yet known, and the Nationals have yet to confirm the report. 
Wieters, who has played eight seasons with the Baltimore Orioles, has made four All-Star appearances, the most recent coming in 2016. He also won a Gold Glove Award in 2011 and 2012. Last year, the catcher hit .243 with 17 home runs, 66 RBIs and a .302 on-base percentage in 124 games. Author
